purpose.summary: These Standard Terms & Conditions apply to all the Company sales incentive compensation plans unless specifically modified in a particular plan document. They are incorporated by reference into each plan document.
objectives: Establish standard terms for all sales incentive compensation plans
Define employment relationship and eligibility requirements
Set payment terms, clawback provisions, and crediting rules

appliesTo: All participants in sales incentive compensation plans
exclusions: Terms specifically modified in a particular plan document

definitions.definition: Employment may be terminated by employee or Company at any time, with or without cause, and with or without notice. Participation in any incentive compensation plan does not alter this status.
Not on unpaid leave of absence (except legally protected leave where required), not under notice of termination (given or received), and performing the duties of the position.
Incentive payments that may be treated as supplemental wages subject to supplemental wage withholding rates.
The designated body with final authority to interpret plan terms and resolve disputes. All interpretations and decisions are final and binding.

provisions.title: Employment Relationship
provisions.content: Defines the nature of the employment relationship and compensation status.

subProvisions.title: At-Will Employment
subProvisions.content: Participation in any incentive compensation plan does not alter the at-will nature of employment. Nothing in this plan or any plan document creates an employment contract or guarantee of continued employment.

subProvisions.title: No Guarantee of Earnings
subProvisions.content: Participation in an incentive plan does not guarantee any specific level of compensation. Actual incentive earnings depend entirely on performance achieved, as measured according to the specific plan terms.

subProvisions.title: Not Part of Base Salary
subProvisions.content: Incentive compensation is variable pay and is not considered part of base salary for any purpose, including but not limited to:
items: Calculation of severance payments
Retirement plan contributions
Overtime calculations (where applicable)
Other benefit calculations

provisions.title: Plan Administration and Modification
provisions.content: The Company retains discretion in plan administration and the right to modify or terminate plans.

subProvisions.title: Company Discretion
subProvisions.content: The Company retains sole and absolute discretion in:
items: Designing, implementing, and administering incentive plans
Interpreting plan terms and resolving ambiguities
Making all final decisions regarding eligibility, performance measurement, and payouts
Determining appropriate corrective actions for errors or unusual circumstances

subProvisions.title: Right to Modify or Terminate
subProvisions.content: The Company reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to modify or terminate any incentive plan at any time, change plan terms, quotas, measures, payout structures, or any other plan element.
items: Prospective changes apply to performance periods beginning after the change effective date
Retroactive changes may be made to correct errors, comply with law, or address extraordinary circumstances

subProvisions.title: Plan Interpretation
subProvisions.content: The Compensation Review Board has final authority to interpret plan terms and resolve disputes. In event of conflict: Plan documents control over communications; official version on file controls over different versions; Standard Terms & Conditions control unless explicitly stated otherwise in the plan.

provisions.title: Eligibility and Participation
provisions.content: Requirements for eligibility and conditions for suspension or termination of eligibility.

subProvisions.title: Eligibility Requirements
subProvisions.content: To be eligible for any incentive plan, you must:
items: Hold an eligible position as defined in the plan
Be actively employed on the date compensation is earned
Not be on a final written warning or Performance Improvement Plan, unless otherwise approved
Comply with all Company policies and standards of conduct
Meet any other eligibility requirements specified in the specific plan

subProvisions.title: Continuous Active Employment Required
subProvisions.content: Unless otherwise specified, you must be actively employed on the date incentive compensation is earned and on the date it is paid to receive payment.

subProvisions.title: Suspension or Termination of Eligibility
subProvisions.content: The Company may suspend or terminate eligibility if:
items: You violate Company policy
You engage in misconduct
You are placed on a Performance Improvement Plan (at Company discretion)
You are under investigation for policy violations or misconduct
Your performance falls below acceptable standards
You fail to meet eligibility requirements

provisions.title: Performance Measurement and Quotas
provisions.content: Rules governing performance data, quota assignments, and performance periods.

subProvisions.title: Performance Data
subProvisions.content: Performance is measured using Company-approved data sources. Participants are responsible for reviewing performance statements and promptly reporting errors. The Company may correct data errors at any time, including after payments have been made.

subProvisions.title: Quota Assignments
subProvisions.content: Quotas are assigned at the Company's sole discretion based on territory potential, historical performance, market conditions, corporate objectives, and other factors. Quotas are goals, not guarantees.

provisions.title: Payment Terms
provisions.content: Terms governing when incentive is earned, how it is paid, and tax withholding.

subProvisions.title: Tax Withholding
subProvisions.content: All incentive payments are subject to:
items: Federal income tax withholding
State and local income tax withholding (where applicable)
FICA (Social Security and Medicare) taxes
Any other applicable taxes or withholdings

subProvisions.title: Payment Timing
subProvisions.content: The Company will make reasonable efforts to pay earned incentive compensation on the scheduled payment dates. Payment may be delayed if additional time is needed to verify performance or resolve discrepancies.

subProvisions.title: Payment Method
subProvisions.content: Payments are made in U.S. Dollars via direct deposit to the designated payroll account or other method as specified by the Company.

provisions.title: Clawback, Recoupment and Adjustments
provisions.content: Provisions for recovering overpayments and adjusting for post-payment events.

subProvisions.title: Overpayment Recovery
subProvisions.content: If you receive an overpayment for any reason, the Company will recover through:
items: Deduction from future incentive payments
Deduction from regular payroll (to the extent permitted by applicable law)
Direct repayment by you
Offset against amounts owed to you by the Company

subProvisions.title: Clawback for Post-Payment Events
subProvisions.content: Incentive payments are subject to clawback for customer-related, performance-related, and conduct-related events:
items: Customer cancels order, returns product, fails to pay (bad debt), or sale is reversed
Performance results later determined to be inaccurate or credit improperly assigned
Payment obtained through fraud, misrepresentation, or misconduct
Violation of Company policy or termination for cause

subProvisions.title: Adjustments for Business Events
subProvisions.content: Incentive payments may be adjusted for pricing corrections, discount or rebate corrections, revenue recognition adjustments, returns, cancellations, or credits, reclassification of sales, inter-company sales adjustments, and other business adjustments. Adjustments may be retroactive.

provisions.title: Crediting and Attribution
provisions.content: Rules governing sales credit allocation and territory/account assignments.

subProvisions.title: Sales Credit Rules
subProvisions.content: The Company has sole discretion to determine which participant(s) receive credit for a sale, the percentage of credit, how credit is split in team selling situations, and treatment of disputed or unusual circumstances.

subProvisions.title: Territory and Account Assignment
subProvisions.content: Sales credit is generally based on territory and account assignments in effect at the time of the sale. The Company may adjust credit for territory changes, account reassignments, or other circumstances.

provisions.title: Caps, Thresholds and Limits
provisions.content: Provisions for payout caps, minimum performance thresholds, and budget caps.

subProvisions.title: Payout Caps
subProvisions.content: When a cap applies, you will not receive payment for performance above the cap. Performance above the cap does not carry over to future periods.

subProvisions.title: Payout Thresholds
subProvisions.content: When a threshold applies, you must achieve the threshold level to earn any payout. Performance below threshold results in zero payout for that component or period.

subProvisions.title: Budget Caps
subProvisions.content: The Company may impose overall budget caps on total incentive payouts. If a budget cap is reached, individual payouts may be reduced pro-rata or payout curves adjusted.

provisions.title: Special Circumstances
provisions.content: Provisions for new hires, transfers, promotions, demotions, leaves of absence, termination, and performance improvement plans.

subProvisions.title: Termination of Employment
subProvisions.content: Treatment varies by termination type:
items: Voluntary Resignation: Eligible for payment only for completed performance periods, pro-rated through last day
Involuntary Termination (Not for Cause): Eligible for payment for completed periods, pro-rated through last day
Termination for Cause: All unpaid incentive compensation may be forfeited at Company discretion
Death: All earned but unpaid incentive compensation paid to estate or designated beneficiary

subProvisions.title: Leave of Absence
subProvisions.content: Protected Leave (FMLA, Military, etc.): Eligibility and quota treatment will comply with applicable law. Personal/Unpaid Leave: Eligibility may be suspended, quota may be adjusted.

provisions.title: Compliance and Legal Requirements
provisions.content: This plan is subject to all applicable federal, state, and local laws. If any provision conflicts with applicable law, the law controls.

subProvisions.title: Applicable Laws
subProvisions.content: Plan is administered in compliance with:
items: Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA)
State wage and hour laws
State commission payment laws
Tax laws (including IRC Section 409A for deferred compensation)
Equal Employment Opportunity laws
ERISA (if applicable)
Data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA, etc.)

provisions.title: Data Privacy
provisions.content: The Company collects and processes personal data for administering incentive compensation plans. Data is shared only to the extent necessary for legitimate business purposes. Compensation data is retained according to the Company's Data Retention Policy.

subProvisions.title: Data Subject Rights (GDPR/CCPA)
subProvisions.content: If located in a jurisdiction with data privacy rights, you may have rights to:
items: Access your personal data
Correct inaccurate data
Request deletion (subject to legal retention requirements)
Object to processing
Other rights as applicable

provisions.title: Confidentiality
provisions.content: Information regarding incentive plans, quotas, compensation amounts, and performance data is confidential and proprietary. Exception: Nothing prohibits discussing your compensation with coworkers, as protected by the National Labor Relations Act.

provisions.title: Disputes and Resolution
provisions.content: Structured dispute process from informal discussion to formal escalation.

subProvisions.title: Dispute Process
subProvisions.content: Five-step dispute resolution process:
items: Step 1: Review your performance statement and plan document
Step 2: Informal discussion with your manager or Sales Operations
Step 3: Submit formal written dispute with specific issue, performance period, your calculation, and supporting documentation
Step 4: Sales Operations investigation and written response
Step 5: Escalation to Compensation Manager, HR, or Comp Review Board

subProvisions.title: Timely Dispute Requirement
subProvisions.content: Disputes must be submitted within the specified timeframe of receipt of payment statement or the date you became aware of the issue. Failure to timely dispute waives your right to dispute the matter.

provisions.title: General Provisions
provisions.content: Standard legal provisions including entire agreement, severability, waiver, assignment, and amendments.

subProvisions.title: Key Provisions
subProvisions.content: Standard legal terms:
items: Entire Agreement: These Terms plus plan document and employment agreement constitute the entire agreement
No Reliance on Oral Statements: Only written plan documents are binding
Severability: Invalid provisions do not affect remaining provisions
Waiver: Failure to enforce does not waive future enforcement rights
Assignment: Rights may not be assigned by participant; Company may assign to successors
Amendments: Company may amend at any time with communication to participants

provisions.title: Acknowledgment and Acceptance
provisions.content: By participating in any incentive compensation plan, participants acknowledge they have received, read, and understand these Standard Terms & Conditions, agree to be bound by them, understand the Company may modify them at any time, and agree to comply with all dispute resolution procedures.
